ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with this course compared to others you have taken was:
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
How would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other F&ES courses you have taken?
Given the course objectives, the level of intellectual challenge of the material covered was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This class enhanced my communication skills specifically as they relate to environmental risk and crisis management.
This course introduced me to environmental and health risk communication and I got to deep dive into the concepts and topics within that.
The best methods of responding to the public during adversities.
Methods of communication and the steps to follow to check for effective risk communication
How to effectively communicate during a crisis or risk situation

I practiced written, visual, and verbal communication skills. I learned how to effectively communicate about environmental risks. Particularly, I learned how to encourage people to be concerned about high risks and how to discourage people from being concerned about non-risks. I also learned about managing communication when people are outraged.

narratives.question_text: How well did the knowledge, skills, and insights gained in this class align with your expectations?
comments: This course was exactly what I anticipated form the course description and introductory lectures.
They matched very well with my expectations.
I learned a lot more than I expected.
Aligned closely, though it could have been more detailed or project based
Aligned with my expectations, was a very effective course
The knowledge, skills, and insights I gained in this class exactly aligned with my expectations.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of the course and how could it be improved?
comments: One of the biggest strengths of this class was the dialogue that Professor Schwarz fostered during class. Exercises that required us to speak in front of the class and critique each other and work together were extremely beneficial. The only weakness of this class I think was there were not enough recent examples used.

This is a really great course, and the small class size allows for very effective class discussions and interactions. I appreciate the use of videos and several examples and in-class activities that greatly enhance learning.
Strengths: The format of the class was well done. Although it was almost three hours long - it felt short and I was able to focus for the entire duration Weaknesses: None
Strengths - good theoretical background and case studies/examples used in class
Did a very good job of incorporating different activities that enhanced learning throughout the course, really liked the videos where we could actively see what was right and wrong.

I gained a lot from practicing my communication skills. I enjoyed the videos we watched and the professor's advice from his experience. The readings were also appropriate and the lectures were effective.

narratives.question_text: What advice would you give to a student considering taking this class?
comments: Always be prepared to speak!
Participate in the in-class activities well. They will really help to understand the course material better.
Take this course. Its interesting and you learn a lot about skills anyone can use
Come prepared with your own examples to better apply the concepts and make it more relevant to your area of interest
Very good way to learn some communication skills critical to your future career.

Take this class if you are interested in any job where you may need to communicate with the public or advise a company that communicates with the public, especially regarding environmental or public health risks.
